title: Ex-NASCAR driver Biffle, family die in plane crash
content: Former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and his family were among seven people killed in a plane crash Thursday in Statesville, North Carolina.

title: Ohio: Smith fired over affair with student, drinking
content: In an intent to terminate letter, Ohio University's president wrote that football coach Brian Smith's "extramarital affairs," including one with a student, brought "disrepute, scandal and ridicule," which violated his employment agreement.

title: Paul predicts knockout in 'biblical' upset of Joshua
content: Jake Paul predicted he would knock out Anthony Joshua in an upset that would be "biblical, like reimagining David beating Goliath."

title: Nacua apologizes, 'had no idea' gesture offensive
content: Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua issued a statement apologizing for performing a gesture on an internet livestream that was "antisemitic in nature and perpetuated harmful stereotypes against Jewish people."

title: Sources: Jaguars, Meyers agree to $60M extension
content: The Jaguars agreed to a three-year, $60 million extension with wide receiver Jakobi Meyers that ties him to Jacksonville through the 2028 season, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 'Locked in' Giannis says agent talk out of his hands
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo said he was "locked in" on getting healthy and told reporters on Thursday afternoon that he can't control reports about his future with the Bucks.

title: Muschamp returns as Horns fire DC Kwiatkowski
content: Will Muschamp is returning to Texas as defensive coordinator after coach Steve Sarkisian fired DC Pete Kwiatkowski and defensive passing game coordinator Duane Akina.

title: ðŸ‘‘ LeBron vs. Father Time: Like no other player
content: LeBron James might be mortal. Zach Kram examines how the future Hall of Famer looks different compared to the past two decades.

title: Coveted head coaching jobs that might come open this offseason
content: Which opening would be most attractive? Let's sort eight possible openings, starting with Cincinnati.

title: On the racetrack or in the air, Greg Biffle will be remembered as a hero
content: Greg Biffle died in a plane crash Thursday in North Carolina, where he'll be remembered not only as a NASCAR star, but as a humanitarian, too.

title: Ranking the top 10 freshmen by impact
content: USC's Jazzy Davidson tops our rankings also featuring Oklahoma's Aaliyah Chavez, UConn's Blanca QuiÃ±onez and more.

title: Texas A&M knocks off Pitt, makes first volleyball final
content: Texas A&M's sweep puts the Aggies in the national championship match for the first time in program history.

title: Geek and destroy: How Bruins winger Morgan Geekie has defied goal-scoring regression
content: Many expected the 27-year-old to take a step back from his 33 goals last season. Instead, he's on pace for 58.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What WNBPA's move to authorize strike means for labor talks
content: The Jan. 9 deadline is still weeks away, but the WNBPA has voted to authorize calling a strike "when necessary" during negotiations.

title: Passan's MLB offseason update: Latest intel on Tucker, Bregman and blockbuster trades
content: While we wait for the next big moves, here's which offseason areas are red-hot -- and which are ice-cold.

title: Free agency reset: Predictions for the remaining top 10
content: A number of impact players are off the market, but there are still big names to be signed. Where do they fit best?

title: Power Rankings: It's Arizona vs. Michigan for No. 1
content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

content: North Carolina's Caleb Wilson rounds out a solid top three while three new names crack the latest edition.

title: Inside the murky future of college walk-on athletes
content: College walk-on athletes remain a fixture of Americana, but a recent settlement has put that storyline in doubt.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the College Football Playoff
content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: FIFA only harming itself with absurd World Cup ticket prices
content: FIFA's sky-high ticket prices for next summer's World Cup could come at the cost of the soul of the game: the fans who make it such a special event.

title: Will another injury derail Adams' World Cup prep for the U.S.?
content: Tyler Adams has been unlucky with injuries, and a recent MCL sprain will rob him of valuable prep time.

title: Wood Brothers' return to NASCAR relevance: 'Faster than we've ever been'
content: Only five of Wood Brothers Racing's 101 Cup Series wins have come after 1993, but the historic team is getting back to the front with Josh Berry.

title: Jaxon Smith-Njigba headlines most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 16
content: Before "Thursday Night Football" kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Student-athlete: Commanders LB Bobby Wagner graduating with MBA from Howard University
content: The Washington Commanders linebacker received his MBA from the historically Black university while being a fully active player.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 16
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: NBA Futures: Thunder remain championship favorites; Knicks' title odds unchanged
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder are still big favorites to repeat as champions, while Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has moved back in front in the MVP race.

title: VB - G RAM G row: Oppn sleeps outside Parliament in protest - watch video
content: Opposition parties staged an overnight dharna in Parliament protesting the passage of the VB-G RAM G Bill, which replaces MGNREGA. MPs accused the government of rushing the legislation without debate, calling it an insult to the poor and a murder of democracy. The government defended the new law, citing its necessity for rural development and employment.

title: Delhi's AQI remains â€˜very poorâ€™ at 330; flights delayed amid dense fog
content: Delhi is grappling with hazardous air quality, with Anand Vihar recording a 'severe' AQI of 442. Dense fog has also disrupted flight operations at the airport. Transport is identified as the primary contributor to the city's pollution, with neighbouring NCR districts also significantly impacting air quality.

title: Brown Univ shooting: Who is Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente? Suspected gunman found dead
content: The suspected shooter in the Brown University shooting, identified as Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente, was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Authorities are investigating potential links between this incident and the death of another Portuguese national in Massachusetts, with a rental car seen at both locations. The FBI has offered a reward for information.

title: Meta CEO Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee reportedly unhappy with his Boss
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill travels with team to Ahmedabad; stage set for fifth T20I
content: Shubman Gill's participation in the series decider against South Africa is uncertain. The Indian vice-captain sustained the blow during a net session prior to the fourth match and was unlikely to feature in Wednesdayâ€™s game in Lucknow, which was eventually washed out because of adverse weather.

title: Lamborghini Urus, Mercedes: ED raids YouTuber Anurag Dwivedi
content: Enforcement Directorate officials seized luxury vehicles from a Uttar Pradesh-based YouTuber. The action is part of a money laundering investigation. This probe is linked to suspected illegal online betting networks. Searches were conducted at multiple locations. Documents related to Dubai real estate investments were recovered. The YouTuber is believed to be living in Dubai and has ignored summons.

title: TikTok row: US joint venture deal signed to avert Chinese ownership ban
content: TikTok has agreed to a joint venture with major investors, including Oracle, to establish a new US-based entity. This move aims to comply with a US law mandating the sale of its American operations or a shutdown, with American and global investors holding over 80% of the new venture.

title: Silicon Valley birthplace draws a line: City plans new rules for Billionaires and their homes
content: Palo Alto is confronting its billionaire residents over their sprawling housing compounds. City Council member Greer Stone plans legislation to restrict perpetual construction, vacant homes, and street disruptions. This initiative stems from years of neighborhood complaints, amplified by reports on Mark Zuckerberg's extensive compound and its impact on the community.

title: Hijab row: Pakistan-based gangster threatens Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
content: In a troubling turn of events, Patna police are probing a video threat linked to a gangster from Pakistan who goes by the name 'Shahzad Bhatti.' The threat specifically targets Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and stems from a controversy over a female doctor being veiled by the CM.

title: â€˜Gambhir is not coachâ€™: Kapil Dev drops bombshell; weighs in on role of head coach
content: Kapil Dev believes Gautam Gambhir's role is more managerial than coaching, emphasizing player management over technical instruction at the international level. Dev highlighted that a coach's primary duty is to build confidence and create a supportive environment, especially for underperforming players, rather than teaching specialist skills.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5%, at its European headquarters in Luxembourg, impacting software developers most significantly. This move follows global layoffs and a push towards AI, though Luxembourg remains a strategic European partner for the company. Affected employees will receive comprehensive support packages.

title: Delhiâ€™s non-BS 6 ban: Chaos, confusion & snarls mark day 1; 2,768 vehicles turned away
content: As the new GRAP Stage IV regulations kicked in, Delhi's borders descended into turmoil. The sudden prohibition on non-Delhi, non-BS 6 vehicles left thousands stranded and confused. Police faced an uphill battle enforcing the ban amidst a sea of vehicles, leading to growing frustration over both the clarity of the rule and its effectiveness in combating pollution.

title: Parliament clears 'G Ram G' Bill: RS passes law hours after LS approval; oppn protests
content: Parliament has passed the Viksit Bharat â€“ Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) or VB-G Ram G Bill, 2025, replacing MGNREGA. The new law aims to enhance rural employment by focusing on durable asset creation and transparency, despite opposition protests over alleged removal of Mahatma Gandhi's name.

title: Bondi Beach attack: Australia to take 'moment to pause and reflect'
content: Australia will hold a national day of reflection on Sunday, December 21, following the deadly Bondi Beach mass shooting. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese urged the nation to reject hatred and violence, announcing a national gun buy-back scheme and tougher measures against antisemitism.

title: Braun Strowman & Raquel Rodriguez net worth 2025: WWE earnings, lifestyle
content: Braun Strowman and Raquel Rodriguez showcase contrasting WWE financial journeys in 2025. Strowman, a former headliner, boasts an estimated net worth of $2-5 million, built on lucrative deals and merchandise. Rodriguez, a rising star, has a projected $700,000, with her value steadily increasing through television exposure and championship opportunities.

title: Inside Josh Allenâ€™s luxury car collection: A look at the Bills starâ€™s garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: How police secretly tracked missing coach Travis Turner before abuse charges
content: Experts believe fugitive football coach Travis Turner was likely caught through a secret police sting or flagged online activity. Authorities say Turner faces 10 child pornography-related charges. While police remain silent, criminologists told the Daily Mail that undercover officers, tech company reports, or device searches likely led to the case.

title: Gisele BÃ¼ndchen spotted jet skiing in Florida with Joaquim Valente
content: Gisele BÃ¼ndchen and Joaquim Valente embraced a sun-drenched holiday with a jet ski outing near their Florida home, prioritizing family and privacy after welcoming their son. This choice reflects BÃ¼ndchen's current focus on grounding moments and personal strength over public spectacle. Meanwhile, Tom Brady confirmed his NFL retirement is permanent due to his ownership stake in the Raiders.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Max Healthcare and Sagility as top stock picks for December 19, 2025. Max Healthcare is recommended for its expansion and cash flow growth, targeting â‚¹1218. Sagility presents a fresh entry opportunity, aiming for â‚¹56, driven by its uptrend and positive structure.

title: GOAT India Tour: Gavaskar slams Messi for Kolkata ruckus - 'Failed to honour commitment'
content: Sunil Gavaskar challenges the narrative blaming Kolkata's Messi event on the organisers. He argues the focus should be on whether Messi himself fulfilled his commitments. Gavaskar suggests that if Messi's team failed to honour agreed-upon activities, they, not local mismanagement, were the primary culprits. He urges checking commitments on both sides before assigning blame.

title: Big update on ticket refunds after Lucknow T20I called off due to fog
content: The UPCA has announced a full refund for spectators after the fourth India-South Africa T20 International was abandoned due to dense fog and smog at Ekana Stadium. Online ticket holders will receive refunds via their original payment method, while offline ticket purchasers can collect theirs from the box office in person with original tickets and ID.

title: IPL 2026: 'Not very professional' - PBKS co-owner slams Josh Inglis over availability
content: Punjab Kings co-owner Ness Wadia slammed Josh Inglis for his "unprofessional" late disclosure of limited availability for IPL 2026 due to his wedding. Wadia expressed disappointment, stating the franchise planned retention around Inglis, only to learn of his brief availability just before the deadline.  Despite criticism, Wadia wished the player well.

title: Business jet crashes at North Carolina airport; 7 killed; video surfaces
content: A Cessna C550 business jet crashed while landing at Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina on Thursday, resulting in a large fireball at the impact site. First responders were seen at the scene as the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) was en route to investigate the incident. The number of people aboard and any injuries or fatalities were not immediately known.

title: MLB trade rumours: Mariners tipped to land $33.6m elite hitter
content: Seattle Mariners are eyeing Bo Bichette to bolster their offense, aiming to complement their strong pitching staff. Bichette's consistent contact and lineup balance would significantly enhance Seattle's chances of contending for a title. A potential long-term deal, estimated between $180-220 million, or a sign-and-trade are being considered, with Bichette open to playing second base.

title: Dhurandhar ends week 2 with Rs 253.5 crore haul; crosses Rs 700 crore at global BO
content: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's 'Dhurandhar' achieved a historic second week at the box office, amassing Rs 253.5 crore net and becoming the highest-grossing second week for a Hindi film. The spy thriller crossed Rs 500 crore gross in India in just 13 days, now standing at Rs 460.

title: IndiGo under CCI scanner after mass cancellations of flights
content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) is investigating IndiGo for potential abuse of dominance and antitrust violations following widespread flight disruptions. The airline, holding over 60% domestic market share, cancelled nearly 5,000 flights, impacting numerous passengers. This probe could lead to fines or other remedies if dominance abuse is established.

title: Exodus: Over 2L Indians renouncing citizenship every year; why are they leaving?
content: Nearly a million Indians have renounced their citizenship in five years, with over two lakh annually since 2022. This trend, raises questions about quality of life, governance, and taxation. While the government cites personal reasons and views the diaspora as an asset, the lack of dual citizenship is a key factor driving this significant outflow.

title: Water crisis: These states are hurtling towards 'Day Zero'; is it too late?
content: India faces a severe water crisis, with 600 million people experiencing extreme stress. Groundwater, the nation's lifeline, is being depleted faster than it replenishes, particularly in agricultural regions. Over-extraction, pollution, and weak regulations are exacerbating the situation, pushing cities and rural areas towards 'Day Zero' scenarios. Urgent action is needed.

title: Yunus declares state mourning for Sharif Osman Hadi, supporters protest in Dhaka
content: Bangladesh observes a day of state mourning following the assassination of youth leader Sharif Osman bin Hadi in Singapore. This comes amidst escalating anti-India protests in Dhaka, with demonstrators demanding an end to alleged conspiracies and the return of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. India has resumed visa services in Dhaka, though some centers remain closed due to security concerns.

title: Bangladesh: Who was Sharif Osman Hadi? Key figure in Sheikh Hasina ouster
content: Sharif Osman Hadi, a prominent leader of the July Uprising that ousted Sheikh Hasina, has died in Singapore after being shot in Dhaka. Hadi, spokesperson for Inqilab Mancha, was targeted while campaigning and succumbed to severe brain injuries. His death has ignited widespread protests and calls for justice.

title: India's job market in 2026: Where hiring will grow & which skills will matter - explained
content: India's job market is rapidly evolving by 2026, prioritizing skills and digital fluency over tenure. Technology-led roles in data science, AI, and cloud computing are booming, alongside growth in green infrastructure, quick commerce, and precision manufacturing. High paychecks are increasingly linked to specialized digital capabilities and niche technical certifications.

title: Quote of the day by Michael Jordan: 'My attitude is that if you push meâ€¦'
content: Michael Jordan, a basketball legend, transformed perceived weaknesses into strengths, a philosophy exemplified by his journey from being cut from his high school team to winning six NBA championships. His resilience and determination, fueled by adversity, serve as a powerful reminder that success often begins when self-doubt ends, inspiring many to embrace challenges.

title: Sourav Ganguly files Rs 50 cr defamation case over Lionel Messi Kolkata event chaos
content: Former India cricket captain Sourav Ganguly has filed a Rs 50 crore defamation suit against Uttam Saha, president of the Argentina Fan Club of Kolkata. Saha had alleged Ganguly's involvement in the chaotic Messi event at Yuva Bharati Stadium. Ganguly, who was an invited guest, denies any organizational role, calling the accusations baseless and damaging to his reputation.

title: The grand old partyâ€™s crisis: Why Congress partymen are parting ways
content: Former Odisha MLA Mohammed Moquim's letter to Sonia Gandhi highlights a growing disconnect between Congress leadership and its workers, echoing concerns raised during recent state elections. The party faces persistent issues like infighting, disillusioned cadres, and senior leaders departing, raising questions about its ability to reform and regain relevance.

title: Shilpa Shetty opens new restaurant amid Rs 60 crore fraud case reports
content: Shilpa Shetty launches her new South Indian restaurant, Ammakai, in Bandra, marking an expansion of her culinary ventures. This comes as she and husband Raj Kundra face a Rs 60 crore fraud case, with police registering an FIR. Kundra denies the allegations, stating a quashing petition is pending in court.

title: Ex-Sabres GM Kevyn Adams leaks confidential contract negotiation details
content: Former Buffalo Sabres general manager Kevyn Adams has sparked fresh NHL controversy. Especially after publicly discussing confidential contract negotiations. That involves forward Alex Tuch. The unexpected disclosure has raised questions around ethics. And player leverage, and Buffaloâ€™s long-term strategy. Mostly, as the franchise approaches a critical trade deadline amid continued playoff struggles.

title: After missing out on Messi moment in Kolkata, teen plays with icon in Hyderabad
content: A 17-year-old fan, Vedang Sharma, who missed Lionel Messi's Kolkata appearance, unexpectedly played alongside his idol in Hyderabad. After securing a last-minute entry, Vedang was called upon to complete the Messi All Stars team for a 7v7 exhibition match, even exchanging passes with Messi himself.

title: 'Greatest challenge since 1971': House panel flags Pak, China influence in B'desh
content: India faces its greatest strategic challenge in Bangladesh since 1971. A parliamentary committee warns of Islamist resurgence, weakening political structures, and growing Chinese and Pakistani influence. This situation poses a long-term strategic test for India's regional stability and neighborhood policy. The government is monitoring developments and engaging with Bangladesh's interim government.

title: Bangladesh On Edge After Student Leader's Death, Media Houses Set On Fire
content: Violent protests broke out in several cities in Bangladesh overnight after the death of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi.

title: Bangladesh Protests LIVE Updates: Violence Erupts After Student Leader Dies
content: Bangladesh Unrest LIVE Updates: Bangladesh has been rocked by violent protests since late Thursday after the death of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with concerns of further unrest ahead of national elections in the country.

title: Suspect Behind Brown University, MIT Shootings Found Dead: Report
content: A man who is suspected of killing two and wounding several others at Brown University has been found dead in a New Hampshire storage facility, a law enforcement said

title: Supreme Court Rejects Salar Jung III Heirs' Claim To Forest Land In Telangana
content: The Supreme Court delivered a major verdict upholding the rights of the Telangana Forest Department over 102 acres of forest land in Ranga Reddy district, rejecting ownership claims made by individuals asserting to be "heirs" of Salar Jung III.

title: "Can't Breathe": Journalists Trapped As Bangladesh Protesters Burn Offices
content: It began with an attack on Bengali-language daily newspaper Prothom Alo, where the crowd had gone chanting slogans before setting the building on fire around midnight.

title: 'G Ram G' Bill, To Replace MGNREGA, Clears Parliament, Opposition Stages Overnight Protest
content: The Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Employment and Livelihood Mission (Rural) Bill --- meant to be an updated version of UPA government's flagship MGNREGA was pushed through parliament within two days amid massive turbulence in both houses.

title: No Evidence Pillar Meant For Lighting Lamps: Tamil Nadu To Court On Deepam Row
content: Arguments concluded in the writ appeal over the Thiruparankundram hill lamp dispute, with the Tamil Nadu government opposing a single judges order allowing the petitioner to light a deepam on an ancient stone pillar near the hilltop dargah.

title: Zohran Mamdani Appointee Resigns Over Old Antisemitic Social Media Posts
content: One of New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani 's appointees has resigned over social media posts she made more than a decade ago that featured antisemitic tropes, Mamdani's office said Thursday.

title: TikTok Signs Deal To Sell US Unit To American Investor-Led Venture
content: ByteDance's TikTok has signed a deal to sell its US entity to a joint venture controlled by American investors, according to a memo from TikTok CEO seen by Reuters.

title: 23-Year-Old Shooter Raped At Faridabad Hotel, 3 Arrested: Cops
content: Three people, including a woman, have been arrested in connection with the alleged rape of a 23-year-old female shooter at a hotel here, police said on Thursday.

title: Opposition Sits On Overnight Protest Against Passage Of G RAM G Bill
content: Opposition leaders staged a 12-hour overnight protest dharna in Parliament complex on Thursday night, while protesting against the passage of the VB-G RAM G bill that seeks to replace the MGNREGA rural employment programme.

title: "It's Malpractice": US Moves To Cut Off Transgender Care For Children
content: The US Department of Health and Human Services on Thursday unveiled a series of regulatory actions designed to block access to gender-affirming care for minors, building on broader Trump administration restrictions targeting transgender Americans.

title: Trump Says "Getting Close To Something" Ahead Of Russia Talks On Ukraine
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said he believes talks toward ending the war in Ukraine are "getting close to something" ahead of a US meeting with Russian officials this weekend.

title: Ex-NASCAR Driver Greg Biffle, Family Among 7 Killed In Jet Crash
content: A business jet crash in North Carolina killed all seven aboard Thursday, reportedly including a former racing car driver, authorities said.

title: Putin To Talk Of War And Peace At Marathon Press Conference Today
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is likely to send a signal to the United States and European powers on Friday over his appetite for peace or more war in Ukraine when he speaks at a marathon end-of-year news conference.

title: Trump Renames Kennedy Arts Center After Himself
content: Donald Trump has been stamping his mark on Washington ever since his return to power. Now in an extraordinary step for a living president, the US capital's top arts venue will also bear his name.

title: Bill Gates, Noam Chomsky Seen In Fresh Pics From Epstein's Estate
content: US House Democrats published a fresh batch of photographs from Jeffrey Epstein's estate, stepping up pressure on Donald Trump's administration on the eve of its deadline to release federal files on the late financier and convicted sex offender.

title: Visakhapatnam-Bound Air India Flight Cancelled Due To Technical Snag
content: A Visakhapatnam-bound Air India flight was cancelled at the Gannavaram Airport near Vijayawada on Thursday due to a technical snag, an official said.

title: Bangladeshi Student Uprising Leader Osman Hadi Dies Week After Being Shot
content: A leader of Bangladesh's 2024 uprising who was wounded in an assassination attempt and flown to Singapore for treatment has died in the city-state, officials said on Friday.

title: BJP vs Left Over Rs 200-Crore Demand From Thiruvananthapuram Civic Body
content: An administration order asking Thiruvananthapuram Corporation to park Rs 200 crore of its own funds in the state treasury has triggered a fierce political clash between the CPM-led Left government and the BJP.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Westbrook continues revival, Huff, George are top-50 players
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Jaren Jackson Jr. and key New York Knicks.

title: Sekkipatti: where Muslims receive temple honours and Hindus worship, make offerings at aÂ dargah
content: Sekkipatti, a village in Melur taluk in Madurai, is a primarily agrarian village that serves as one of the best examples of religious harmony between Hindus and Muslims that can be seen in southern Tamil Nadu. In the village, there is no discrimination between the two communities, and a traditional familial kinship has existed throughout the years

title: When two warring groups of the Congress met in Thirupparankundram for talks 80 years ago
content: While one faction was headed by TNCC president K. Kamaraj, the other was led by veteran leader C. Rajagopalachari. The conference debated on the formal re-entry of the latter into the organisation after he left following differences with Mahatma Gandhi and others over the Muslim Leagueâ€™s demand for the creation of Pakistan

title: Could rewiring macrophage metabolism make TB treatments shorter?
content: Indian researchers have reported that macrophage metabolism shapes the tolerance of the TB bacterium to drugs; by pushing infected immune cells to generate energy using glycolysis, they were able to render bacteria more vulnerable

title: Why Indiaâ€™s export growth defied U.S. Tariffs: The data explained
content: Indian exporters are successfully mitigating the impact of U.S. market losses by rapidly diversifying into alternative global markets

title: Children test HIV positive in Satna: M.P. govt suspends 3, including blood bank in-charge
content: The action was taken based on the preliminary report of a committee formed to investigate the case of transfusion of infected blood in Satna

title: Who will make Karnatakaâ€™s traditional toys next?
content: Channapatna and Kinnal in Karnataka are known for the unique toys generations of artisans have been making and enjoy Geographical Indicator tags. But the craft in these towns face an existential crisis as the younger people in the toy-making families are choosing jobs in cities, reports Rishita Khanna.

title: Nitish hijab row escalates: Giriraj Singh says woman can 'go to hell', clamour for apology grows
content: If someone is going to collect an appointment letter, should they not show their face? Is this some Islamic country? Nitish Kumar acted as a guardian, Giriraj Singh argued

title: Under mounting public criticism, Odisha BJP MLAs urge CM to reconsider their salary hike
content: The proposed hike of over 200% would place Odishaâ€™s legislators ahead of their counterparts in all other States, a message that reportedly did not go down well with the BJPâ€™s central leadership.

title: Bahraich wolf attacks | Terror before sundown
content: A series of wolf attacks in theÂ BahraichÂ district of Uttar Pradesh has left 9 children and an elderly couple dead and 30 injured over the past three months. As fear grips the villages, young men patrol their neighbourhoods at nights while the children, women, and the elderly stay home after sundown, findsÂ IshitaÂ Mishra

content: The courtÂ saysÂ policeÂ areÂ acting in â€˜utter disregard to mandate of lawâ€™;Â citizens are summoned under vague rules andÂ demandsÂ clarity on BNSS applicability and legality of summons practices.Â

content: â€œOn one hand, there is unemployment, on the other such productive orchards were being handed over to the BSF. Where will locals go?,â€ Ms. Mufti saidÂ

title: Diabetes Atlas projections indicate 900 million people will have diabetes in 2050
content: The paper stresses stronger efforts to slow down progression of the disease around the world, with strategies tailored appropriately across countries and population groups

title: In Rajya Sabha, Opposition flags lack of consultations before tabling new rural jobs Bill
content: They also invoked the example of the three farm laws, which they said were passed under similar circumstances and later withdrawn after a prolonged farmersâ€™ agitation. This Bill will also face the same fate, they said.

title: Opposition sits on overnight protest in parliament against passage of G RAM G bill
content: Trinamool Congress Rajya Sabha deputy leader Sagarika Ghose accused the Union government of bulldozing the VB- G RAM G Bill, as Opposition MPs sat on a 12-hour dharna in the Parliament complex.

title: Two-wheelers, autorickshaws continue to flout ban on Bengaluruâ€“Mysuru highway; commuters raise safety concerns
content: It has been nearly two years since the National Highways Authority of India enforced restrictions barring certain categories of vehicles from using the main carriageway of the Bengaluruâ€“Mysuru highway

title: Finding resolution to tariff issues with U.S., the only way to address exchange rate issues: C. Rangarajan
content: Former governor of the Reserve Bank of India delivers the Madras Institute of Development Studies (MIDS) Founderâ€™s Day Lecture at an event organised at Anna Centenary Library

content: KejriwalÂ says partyâ€™s victory in rural polls reflects peopleâ€™s trust; Cong. calls it a â€˜stolenâ€™ victory, says ruling party misused administration, police

title: More land being acquired to construct flyovers on CTH Road
content: Around 60% of the land acquisition for the facility at Avadi has been completed. At Ambattur, the process is nearly complete, with the Highways Department awaiting the State governmentâ€™s administrative sanction for the cost of acquisitionÂ

title: â€˜Sar Tan Se Judaâ€™ slogan is a challenge to the authority of law as well as sovereignty of India, says Allahabad High Court
content: Refusing bail to a person accused of reciting this slogan, Bench of justice Arun Kumar Singh Deshwal, added that the slogan incites the people for arm rebellion and is against the basic tenets of Islam

title: Samji Arattupuzhaâ€™s new song captures the nostalgia of Kerala church band music
content: Why Samji Arattupuzhaâ€™s new song feels like Christmas at a Kerala Church. He has over 500 Christian devotional songs to his credit

title: EC to publish integrated draft electoral roll for Tamil Nadu on December 19
content: Chief Electoral Officer Archana Patnaik is scheduled to address a press conference in Chennai on Friday afternoon regarding the publication of the integrated draft electoral roll.

title: Digitisation of SIR forms completed in Kozhikode
content: Forms received by the deadline will be included in the draft electoral roll, scheduled for publication on December 23

title: No empirical data available to prove stone pillar on Thirupparankundram hill is a deepathoon, T.N. tells HC
content: Advocate-General P.S. Raman, representing the State, told the court that the State had not formed an opinion on the stone pillar, and did not wish to take a stand on the matter

title: Trade unions, farmersâ€™ outfits demand withdrawal of SHANTI Bill

title: Experts call for neuro-justice framework in motor accident cases
content: While India recorded about 1.77 lakh road accident deaths in 2024, official statistics do not capture the far larger number of survivors left with lifelong neurological disabilities following head, spinal cord, and nerve injuries

title: Mob vandalises prayer hall over burial dispute in Bastar

title: Burn in the USA: Trump admin to speed up denaturalization

title: Southall gurdwara property raided by UK police and immigration
content: the property, 11 Beaconsfield Road, is one of eight properties belonging to Sri Guru Singh Sabha Southall . the properties are meant to house staff serving the gurdwara and visiting preachers from india . police have not confirmed what he was arrested for, but a member of the congregation told TOI an Indian-origin Sikh man is arrested for drugs and money laundering .

title: 'Don't show 6 films': MEA 'warns' Kerala fest; 3 already screened, other 3 to be pulled

title: Follow live: Rams, Seahawks in back-and-forth scoring affair
content: The  Los Angeles Rams  (11-3) enter their Week 16 "Thursday Night Football" game at the  Seattle Seahawks  (11-3) as the No. 1 seed in the NFC West and in the conference. Thursday's game could alter that with the Seahawks on their tail. The Rams clinched a playoff berth last week but are playing for the No. 1 overall seed and a wild-card round bye. The Seahawks can clinch a playoff berth with a win Thursday or a  Detroit Lions  loss vs. the  Pittsburgh Steelers  on Sunday. Rams reporter Sarah Barshop and Seahawks reporter Brady Henderson are on-site to provide all the highlights throughout the night right here.

title: TCU QB Hoover to enter portal, miss Alamo Bowl
